intro: Tephrosia nseleensis, commonly known as the African tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing ability. The plant typically grows as an erect shrub with compound leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of yellow or white. Its seeds are enclosed in pods and are often used in traditional medicine for their potential health benefits. The botanical features of Tephrosia nseleensis make it an important species in both ecological and agricultural contexts.
